results.title: Manifesto
results.creator_credit: Bayerischer Rundfunk, Schiwago Film and Julian Rosefeldt
results.brief_description: Julian Rosefeldt’s outstanding tribute to various art manifestos of the 19th and 20th century, ranging from Communism to Dogme, in connection with 13 different characters played by Cate Blanchett. A striking humorous audio-visual experience.

constellations_other.name: Clones, doubles and doppelgangers
constellations_other.description: Multiple characters and doubles materialise in this Constellation inspired by the pioneering special effects of Georges Méliès.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bayerischer Rundfunk, Schiwago Film and Julian Rosefeldt
results.description: An outstanding tribute to various (art) manifestos of the nineteenth and twentieth century, ranging from Communism to Dogme, in connection with thirteen different characters, including a homeless man, a factory worker and a corporate CEO, who are all played by Cate Blanchett. A striking humorous audio-visual experience.
description_for_label: An outstanding tribute to various (art) manifestos of the nineteenth and twentieth century, ranging from Communism to Dogme, in connection with thirteen different characters, including a homeless man, a factory worker and a corporate CEO, who are all played by Cate Blanchett. A striking humorous audio-visual experience.

results.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
results.brief_description: In the criminal justice system, sexually-based offenses are considered especially heinous. In New York City, the dedicated detectives who investigate these vicious felonies are members of an elite squad known as the Special Victims Unit. These are their stories.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.description: In the criminal justice system, sexually-based offenses are considered especially heinous. In New York City, the dedicated detectives who investigate these vicious felonies are members of an elite squad known as the Special Victims Unit. These are their stories.

results.title: GoodFellas
results.creator_credit: Winkler Films, Kristi Zea, Irwin Winkler, Martin Scorsese, Nicholas Pileggi and Richard Bruno
results.headline_credit: United States and United States of America, 1990
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of Scorsese’s finest – and most disturbing – films, Goodfellas explores a world where mobsters ruled the roost, splashed the cash, controlled the cops and provided glamorous role models – before it comes crashing down.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

constellations_other.name: Culture, food and family
constellations_other.description: Food as a link to culture and family.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Winkler Films, Kristi Zea, Irwin Winkler, Martin Scorsese, Nicholas Pileggi and Richard Bruno
results.headline_credit_for_label: United States and United States of America, 1990
results.description: The true story of Henry Hill, a half-Irish, half-Sicilian Brooklyn kid who is adopted by neighbourhood gangsters at an early age and climbs the ranks of a Mafia family under the guidance of Jimmy Conway.
description_for_label: The true story of Henry Hill, a half-Irish, half-Sicilian Brooklyn kid who is adopted by neighbourhood gangsters at an early age and climbs the ranks of a Mafia family under the guidance of Jimmy Conway.

results.title: Forrest Gump
results.creator_credit: The Steve Tisch Company and Charles Newirth
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as one of the most memorable characters in cinematic history, Forrest Gump, the big-hearted man who was there in the biggest moments in American history. Directed by Robert Zemeckis and written by Eric Roth won six Academy Awards.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.creator_credit_for_label: The Steve Tisch Company and Charles Newirth
results.description: A man with a low IQ has accomplished great things in his life and been present during significant historic events—in each case, far exceeding what anyone imagined he could do. But despite all he has achieved, his one true love eludes him.
description_for_label: A man with a low IQ has accomplished great things in his life and been present during significant historic events—in each case, far exceeding what anyone imagined he could do. But despite all he has achieved, his one true love eludes him.

results.title: First Australians
results.brief_description: First Australians is a historical documentary series produced by Blackfella Films over the course of six years, and first aired in October 2008.

constellations_other.name: Women in charge
constellations_other.description: Across documentary, film, TV, and visual art, Aboriginal women have led how they will be represented on-screen.

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

constellations_other.name: Keep the fire burning
constellations_other.description: Yanmeeyarr, meaning ‘flickering in firelight’, shares how light and shadow are at the core of the moving image. It reflects the past, present and future of stories told by First Peoples utilising these elements, as well as bringing to light stories that have, for too long, been kept in the dark.

results.description:
First Australians is an Australian historical documentary series produced by Blackfella Films over the course of six years, and first aired in October 2008. The documentary is part of a greater project that further consists of a hard-cover book, a community outreach program and a substantial website featuring over 200 mini-documentaries.

The series chronicles the history of contemporary Australia, from the perspective of its First Peoples. The series is essentially a synthesis of well documented historical information. It relies heavily on archival documents and interpretations from historians and members of both the Indigenous and European community and leaders. The story begins in 1788 in Sydney, with the arrival of the First Fleet and ends in 1993 with Koiki Mabo’s legal challenge to the foundation of Australia.

The series comprises seven episodes in which it explores what unfolded when the oldest living culture in the world was confronted by the British Empire. It explores the lives of particular individuals and uses their stories as a vehicle to explain the larger situations of the time. It explains violent aspects of European settlement of Australia, such as killings, battles, wars, as well as acts of friendship and decency between the early European settlers and Indigenous Australians. Indigenous Australian history has until recently been clouded by the “great Australian silence” where ignorance of the real history of Australia can be seen as a way for non-Indigenous to hide shame for their own history. In this respect it has been controversial in that many of these stories have not been portrayed on Australian television before and the Indigenous Australian perspective of European settlement is confrontational for many.
description_for_label:
First Australians is an Australian historical documentary series produced by Blackfella Films over the course of six years, and first aired in October 2008. The documentary is part of a greater project that further consists of a hard-cover book, a community outreach program and a substantial website featuring over 200 mini-documentaries.

The series chronicles the history of contemporary Australia, from the perspective of its First Peoples. The series is essentially a synthesis of well documented historical information. It relies heavily on archival documents and interpretations from historians and members of both the Indigenous and European community and leaders. The story begins in 1788 in Sydney, with the arrival of the First Fleet and ends in 1993 with Koiki Mabo’s legal challenge to the foundation of Australia.

The series comprises seven episodes in which it explores what unfolded when the oldest living culture in the world was confronted by the British Empire. In this respect it has been controversial in that many of these stories have not been portrayed on Australian television before and the Indigenous Australian perspective of European settlement is confrontational for many.

results.title: Dr. No
results.creator_credit: United Artists, Eon Productions, Danjaq, Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, Berkely Mather, Ken Adam, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and Terence Young
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1962
results.brief_description: In 1962, audiences were introduced to the suave super spy James Bond in the first instalment of the classic franchise, <.i>Dr. No. Bond, James Bond has since shot up the screen 25 times and become a pop-culture icon.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

results.creator_credit_for_label: United Artists, Eon Productions, Danjaq, Richard Maibaum, Johanna Harwood, Berkely Mather, Ken Adam, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and Terence Young
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1962
results.description: In the film that launched the James Bond saga, Agent 007 battles mysterious Dr. No, a scientific genius bent on destroying the U.S. space program. As the countdown to disaster begins, Bond must go to Jamaica, where he encounters beautiful Honey Ryder, to confront a megalomaniacal villain in his massive island headquarters.

results.title: Cowboy Bebop
results.creator_credit: Sunrise, SUNRISE, Bandai Visual, Sound Box, Kazuhiko Ikeguchi and Masahiko Minami
results.brief_description: Set in 2071 and centered on the adventures of a gang of bounty hunters in space, Cowboy Bebop delves into the unresolved issues of the protagonists’ past, exploring concepts such as existentialism, boredom, loneliness and the past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sunrise, SUNRISE, Bandai Visual, Sound Box, Kazuhiko Ikeguchi and Masahiko Minami
results.description: In 2071, roughly fifty years after an accident with a hyperspace gateway made the Earth almost uninhabitable, humanity has colonized most of the rocky planets and moons of the Solar System. Amid a rising crime rate, the Inter Solar System Police (ISSP) set up a legalized contract system, in which registered bounty hunters (also referred to as “Cowboys”) chase criminals and bring them in alive in return for a reward.
description_for_label: In 2071, roughly fifty years after an accident with a hyperspace gateway made the Earth almost uninhabitable, humanity has colonized most of the rocky planets and moons of the Solar System. Amid a rising crime rate, the Inter Solar System Police (ISSP) set up a legalized contract system, in which registered bounty hunters (also referred to as “Cowboys”) chase criminals and bring them in alive in return for a reward.

video_links.name: Cowboy Bebop HD - Trailer - Complete Series on Blu-ray - Coming Soon

results.title: Zootopia
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Animation Studios, Byron Howard, Rich Moore, Phil Johnston, Jared Bush and Cory Loftis
results.brief_description: Determined to prove herself, Officer Judy Hopps, the first bunny on Zootopia’s police force, jumps at the chance to crack her first case - even if it means partnering with scam-artist fox Nick Wilde to solve the mystery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Animation Studios, Byron Howard, Rich Moore, Phil Johnston, Jared Bush and Cory Loftis
results.description:
Walt Disney Animation Studio’s Academy Award-winning Zootopia (2016) follows a rookie cop who sets out to uncover a dangerous conspiracy that’s turning the peaceful animals of Zootopia back into their savage states. A small-town bunny rabbit, Judy Hopps (Ginnifer Goodwin) has to work with the sly fox Nick Wilde (Jason Bateman), a hustler who can guide her through the city’s underworld to get to the bottom of the case.

This concept sketch by Cory Loftis represents the bustling metropolis teeming with instantly classic animal characters, including Judy and Nick, but also Chief Bogo (Idris Elba), Benjamin Clawhauser (Nate Torrence), Dawn Bellwether (Jenny Slate) and Yax (Tommy Chong).

Winner of the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature, as well as the Golden Globe, Critic’s Choice Movie Award and the Annie Award, Zootopia was critically acclaimed for its memorable characters, animation and story about seeing past our prejudices.
description_for_label:

A small-town bunny rabbit, Judy Hopps (Ginnifer Goodwin) has to work with the sly fox Nick Wilde (Jason Bateman), a hustler who can guide her through the city’s underworld to get to the bottom of the case.

This concept sketch by Cory Loftis represents the bustling metropolis teeming with instantly classic animal characters, including Judy and Nick, but also Chief Bogo (Idris Elba), Benjamin Clawhauser (Nate Torrence), Dawn Bellwether (Jenny Slate) and Yax (Tommy Chong).

Winner of the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature, as well as the Golden Globe, Critic’s Choice Movie Award and the Annie Award, Zootopia was critically acclaimed for its memorable characters, animation and story about seeing past our prejudices.

results.title: Xena: Warrior Princess
results.brief_description: Xena is an infamous warrior on a quest to seek redemption for her past sins against the innocent. Accompanied by her comrade-in-arms Gabrielle, the couple use their formidable fighting skills to help those who are unable to defend themselves.

constellations_other.name: Boom mics, Clara Bow and musicals
constellations_other.description: The microphone was called the "terror of the studios" when sound films were introduced in the late 1920s, but after initial resistance Hollywood fully embraced the new technology.

constellations_other.name: Television and creative constraint
constellations_other.description: Making art for the screen is dependent on time, resources, and infrastructure. Where technology could have posed a barrier, these television producers saw an opportunity, instead.

results.description: Xena is an infamous warrior on a quest to seek redemption for her past sins against the innocent. Accompanied her comrade-in-arms Gabrielle, the campy couple use their formidable fighting skills to help those who are unable to defend themselves.
description_for_label: Xena is an infamous warrior on a quest to seek redemption for her past sins against the innocent. Accompanied her comrade-in-arms Gabrielle, the campy couple use their formidable fighting skills to help those who are unable to defend themselves.

results.title: Workout
results.brief_description: Jane Fonda’s Workout is the original VHS workout program. The program includes a 30 minute beginners’ class and a 60 minute advanced session. Fond would go on to release 23 different home workout videos and sell more than 17 million copies.

constellations_other.name: Technology and work
constellations_other.description: How does the godfather of animation and sprocket technology connect to Jane Fonda workout videos and a Jesus biopic?

results.description: Jane Fonda’s Workout is the original VHS workout program, inspired by her best-selling book. The program includes a 30-minute beginners’ class and a 60-minute advanced session. Fonda would go on to release 23 different home workout videos and sell more than 17 million copies.
description_for_label: Jane Fonda’s Workout is the original VHS workout program, inspired by her best-selling book. The program includes a 30-minute beginners’ class and a 60-minute advanced session. Fonda would go on to release 23 different home workout videos and sell more than 17 million copies.
